content.raw:
merged, ea13d47. Thanks!

I reverted back to the cone shape laser sweep, so modified your test to pass in afb90e2. I tried to keep your original approach but just ended up checking ray-plane intersection point to have a z pos of 0. Feel free to make it better.
content.html:
merged, ea13d47. Thanks!

I reverted back to the cone shape laser sweep, so modified your test to pass in afb90e2. I tried to keep your original approach but just ended up checking ray-plane intersection point to have a z pos of 0. Feel free to make it better.

I'm getting a failing test: PhysicsEngines/LaserTest.LaserBox/1 when I test against bullet 2.82; I need to check if it's a problem for 2.81.

[ RUN      ] PhysicsEngines/LaserTest.LaserBox/1

Msg Publicized address: 192.168.1.187

The difference between raySensor->GetRange(mid) and expectedRangeAtMidPoint is 0.032520152880762265, which exceeds 1e-5, where

expectedRangeAtMidPoint evaluates to 0.5, and
1e-5 evaluates to 1.0000000000000001e-05.

The difference between raySensor->GetRange(0) and expectedRangeAtMidPoint is 0.032513700277104096, which exceeds 1e-5, where

expectedRangeAtMidPoint evaluates to 0.5, and

~~~

content.raw:
More info on the ground plane intersection bug: see this pull request's description Update2

Fix is in 2f8d0ec, difference between the laser scans can be seen [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/rsielk9o4pbuwl2/laser_vertical_planes.png)

update.description:
issue #509

cpu ray sensor working, still need to fix the gpu version

Limit 2D laser topic visualization to the first laser plane 

Added an integration test 

Update: Fixed vertical gpu_laser elements in test worlds, added laser_vertical.world

Update2: MultiRayShape was casting rays that form a curved plane for scans taken at non-zero pitch angles.  2f8d0ec fixes it so that each scan is now on a flat plane.
update.title: Fix ray sensor vertical ranges

content.raw:
here is what I used for testing. I just placed the sdf element below inside the `<scan>` section of hokuyo's `model.sdf`

```
#!c++
            <vertical>
              <samples>3</samples>
              <resolution>1</resolution>
              <min_angle>-0.1</min_angle>
              <max_angle>0.1</max_angle>
            </vertical>
```
content.html:
here is what I used for testing. I just placed the sdf element below inside the <scan> section of hokuyo's model.sdf

            <vertical>
              <samples>3</samples>
              <resolution>1</resolution>
              <min_angle>-0.1</min_angle>
              <max_angle>0.1</max_angle>
            </vertical>
